item.title: Probability
item.description: Probability theory and stochastic processes for physicists (T) - Probability Course Probability theory and stochastic processes for physicists (T) Course No. Probability Category Type Language Teaching hours CP Semester Elective Lecture English 3 4 WT Requirements for Participation: Preparation: Statistical mechanics on the bachelor level Form of Testing and Examination: Oral examination or term paper Length of Course: 1 semester Aims of the Course: Acquaintance with probabilistic concepts and stochastic methods commonly used in the theory of disordered systems and nonequilibrium phenomena, as well as in interdisciplinary applications of statistical physics.
